title: How to Do a 2 Card Monte Card Trick

steps.headline: Put a heart, spade, and a diamond at the top of the deck.
steps.description: Make sure that you have the spade between the two and place this on top. Place a club on the bottom of the deck. For example, on top of the deck you have an ace of hearts first, queen of spades second and ace of diamonds third. The bottom card of the deck is the queen of clubs. Now you are ready!

steps.headline: Start by lifting off the top card (ace of hearts) and say, "Remember hearts."
Give this card to the spectator between his thumb and index finger (so it looks like he or she is pinching the card) face down.
Do a double lift and show the ace of diamonds and say, "Diamond."
steps.description: (To give you some time to get a double lift ready, ask the spectator what card he has and to look at it to make sure it is ok.)

steps.headline: Place the diamond with the queen behind it on top of the deck and give the spectator the queen which he thinks is the diamond.
steps.description: Place this on top of the ace of hearts. Say, "I will teach you the move in slow motion."

steps.headline: Put the queen on top take the heart from underneath, and turn it around to show the spectator and say, "See, I have the heart."
Shove the heart between the spectator's fingers fast.
steps.description: What you are trying to do here is make the spectator believe that you are switching the heart and the diamond. After you shove it in and out your hand goes to the top of the deck, releases the heart, and grabs the other queen from the bottom of the deck.

steps.headline: Put the queen on top of the other queen in spectators hand and that is it.
steps.description: The most difficult part of this trick is the last switch. To make it easier, you have to keep on talking. While you are switching from the deck say, "Now, do you bet the heart is on the top or bottom?" You have to be quick and keep the spectator's eyes off of the deck. The spectator will then make a prediction but they are totally wrong!

text: Put a heart, spade, and a diamond at the top of the deck. Make sure that you have the spade between the two and place this on top. Place a club on the bottom of the deck. For example, on top of the deck you have an ace of hearts first, queen of spades second and ace of diamonds third. The bottom card of the deck is the queen of clubs. Now you are ready! Start by lifting off the top card (ace of hearts) and say, "Remember hearts."  Give this card to the spectator between his thumb and index finger (so it looks like he or she is pinching the card) face down.  Do a double lift and show the ace of diamonds and say, "Diamond." (To give you some time to get a double lift ready, ask the spectator what card he has and to look at it to make sure it is ok.) Place the diamond with the queen behind it on top of the deck and give the spectator the queen which he thinks is the diamond. Place this on top of the ace of hearts. Say, "I will teach you the move in slow motion." Put the queen on top take the heart from underneath, and turn it around to show the spectator and say, "See, I have the heart."  Shove the heart between the spectator's fingers fast. What you are trying to do here is make the spectator believe that you are switching the heart and the diamond. After you shove it in and out your hand goes to the top of the deck, releases the heart, and grabs the other queen from the bottom of the deck. Put the queen on top of the other queen in spectators hand and that is it. The most difficult part of this trick is the last switch. To make it easier, you have to keep on talking. While you are switching from the deck say, "Now, do you bet the heart is on the top or bottom?" You have to be quick and keep the spectator's eyes off of the deck. The spectator will then make a prediction but they are totally wrong!
sentences: Put a heart, spade, and a diamond at the top of the deck.
Make sure that you have the spade between the two and place this on top.
Place a club on the bottom of the deck.
For example, on top of the deck you have an ace of hearts first, queen of spades second and ace of diamonds third.
The bottom card of the deck is the queen of clubs.
Now you are ready!
Start by lifting off the top card (ace of hearts) and say, "Remember hearts."
Give this card to the spectator between his thumb and index finger (so it looks like he or she is pinching the card) face down.
Do a double lift and show the ace of diamonds and say, "Diamond."

(To give you some time to get a double lift ready, ask the spectator what card he has and to look at it to make sure it is ok.) Place the diamond with the queen behind it on top of the deck and give the spectator the queen which he thinks is the diamond.
Place this on top of the ace of hearts.
Say, "I will teach you the move in slow motion."
Put the queen on top take the heart from underneath, and turn it around to show the spectator and say, "See, I have the heart."
Shove the heart between the spectator's fingers fast.
What you are trying to do here is make the spectator believe that you are switching the heart and the diamond.
After you shove it in and out your hand goes to the top of the deck, releases the heart, and grabs the other queen from the bottom of the deck.
Put the queen on top of the other queen in spectators hand and that is it.
The most difficult part of this trick is the last switch.
To make it easier, you have to keep on talking.
While you are switching from the deck say, "Now, do you bet the heart is on the top or bottom?"
You have to be quick and keep the spectator's eyes off of the deck.
The spectator will then make a prediction but they are totally wrong!
tyn_section: A deck of cards, and some magical know how.
